data.title: The 2016 Nobel Peace Prize goes to Colombian President Juan Manuel Santos for his resolute efforts to bring the country's more than 50-year-long civil war to an end, a war that has cost the lives of at least 220 000 Colombians and displaced close to six million people.
Syrian migrant helps capture ISIS terrorist who tortured him in his home country after spotting the Islamist in Germany
US officially names Russia as culprit behind DNC hack

Iceland has found nine senior bankers guilty for crimes relating to the economic meltdown in 2008: The Supreme Court in Reykjavik returned guilty verdicts for all nine defendants in the Kaupthing Bank market manipulation case, one of the biggest cases of its kind in Iceland's history.
Hurricane Matthew Death Toll Hits 842 in Haiti
India's highest-ranking economist just announced his support for universal basic income
